title: Bug 41347: CCombo fires defaultSelection on mouse list selection
description:
Bug 41347: CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection

The current behavior of CCombo is that it fires a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the drop-down list using the mouse. This behavior is different from standard Combos and can be confusing for users. A typical user of a combobox would be very surprised to have the dialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected.

Please fix this issue so that CCombo behaves consistently with standard Combos.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Drop down the CCombo list using the mouse.
2. Select an entry from the list using the mouse.

Expected behavior:
- CCombo should not fire a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected using the mouse.

Actual behavior:
- CCombo fires a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected using the mouse.
OB: When the drop-down list of the CCombo is opened and an entry is selected using the mouse, a defaultSelection event is fired by the CCombo. This behavior is different from standard Combos.
EB: CCombo fires a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the drop-down list using the mouse. This behavior should be changed so that CCombo behaves consistently with standard Combos.
SR: Fix the CCombo so that it does not fire a defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the drop-down list using the mouse. The behavior of CCombo should be consistent with standard Combos.
